docs.text: the truman show ( paramount pictures ) running time : 1 hour 42 minutes starring jim carrey and ed harris directed by peter weir after a long wait , jim carrey's dramatic debut finally makes it to the big screen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in case you've been asleep for the last few months , the plot centres on truman burbank ( carrey ) who leads an seemingly idyllic life in the beautiful town of seahaven .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his life seems so perfect , however , because it's controlled by christoff ( harris ) creator of the truman show , the program burbank is unwittingly the hero of .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that's right , burbank's life is being broadcast live to the american public , and seahaven and all it's inhabitants are inclosed in a massive sound stage .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film takes the jerry springer format one step too far . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with an idea so different , it would be easy for the director and screenwriter to dumb it down and appeal to the lowest common denominator .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: luckily , the film remains sensible enough to appeal to all ages , yet never seems to be a dumb carrey movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: talking of carrey , he's perfect in this movie , enjoying the best role in his career .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his character is a re-inforced stanley ipkiss from the mask ( 1994 ) and is completely suited to carrey's persona .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he occasionally falls into ace ventura mode , shrieking and being silly , but generally the audience is watching subdued carrey .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he's not completely dramatic like the film promises , however .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ed harris brings an extreme intensity to christoff , the megalomaniac creator of the show .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: quiet and well spoken , he burns an image into the viewer .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unfortunately , he's barely in the film , and for the first hour dosen't appear at all !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: also disappointing is natascha mcelhone's character sylvia .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she plays the role well , but her character is sadly underwritten and is pushed to the sidelines just when the audience is used to her .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the supporting cast is excellent , and the town of seahaven looks delightfully perfect , so perfect it's creepy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the philip glass soundtrack is also superb , and is used to great effect during the film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: peter weir keeps the film going , clearly having fun .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film is far more upbeat than his previous films dead poets society and green card .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: although it is slightly slow to begin with , about half an hour into film the pace really picks up , and when christoff is introduced fully the film is on a roll .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sadly , though , the film is practically over when the film is in full steam .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: also , concerning the ending , it is slightly too ambiguous , which was disappointing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the screenwriter , andrew niccol , who bought us gattaca ( 1997 ) delivers an entertaining script , and manages to keep the plot in trim .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while christoff's plans to keep truman in do get increasingly silly , they never go over the line , which would have been easy for niccol to do .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: also , there's some funny gags involving product placement and the people who watch the show .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: overall , the truman show is excellent entertainment .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: certainly different from the usual crap hollywood produces , it should be viewed by everyone .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it offers something to every member of the audience , and you would almost certainly not come out disappointed .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: overall rating=
docs.label: positive

docs.text: review by david wilcock ? 1998
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " you know , for kids " - norville barnes
docs.label: positive
